author: jsign
content:
I think the answer to this question https://notes.ethereum.org/@vbuterin/proto_danksharding_faq#What-does-the-KZG-trusted-setup-look-like needs to be updated to reflect that now `n_2 = 65`.
(not exactly sure who can edit this document; sending here if someone might know)

author: cheechyuan.eth
content: Hi another question. I see that the contributions in json is given in hex (G1 and G2). may i know how is it represented? is it similar to eip2537 where the hex is a concatenation of x and y affine coordinates?

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> no, itâ€™s just the affine x coordinate, but with an extra few bits representing which y coordinate: https://github.com/zkcrypto/pairing/blob/34aa52b0f7bef705917252ea63e5a13fa01af551/src/bls12_381/README.md#serialization

author: cheechyuan.eth
content: ah thanks for clearing it up for me

author: cheechyuan.eth
content: ~~btw could you point me to the specs which describes this? cant seem to find it~~
